New Records: Keider Montero became the first Tigers pitcher to face the minimum 27 batters since Justin Verlander's no-hitter in 2011.
Keider Montero threw a Maddux, matching Greg Maddux's record of shutouts in fewer than 100 pitches.
Key Match Events: Keider Montero pitched a complete game, shutting out the Colorado Rockies 11-0.
Montero's performance was a turning point in the Tigers' season, highlighted by his emotional reaction and the team's growing success.
Post-Match Reflections: Detroit Tigers manager A.J. Hinch praised Montero's development and competitiveness, emphasizing his role in the team's playoff push.
